titles.title: To provide for a temporary increase in the public debt limit.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by the Yeas and Nays: 23 - 14.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E760)
Reported by the Committee on Ways and Means. H. Rept. 103-43.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 19.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E841)

Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 147 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1430 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. The bill shall be considered in the House and all points of order against the bill and against its consideration are waived. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments. Upon passage by the House, H.R. 1430 shall be considered to constitute reconciliation legislation pursuant to section 7(a) of the conference report to accompany the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 64) setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for the fiscal years 1994, 1995, 1996, 1997, and 1998.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 147.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1430 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. The bill shall be considered in the House and all points of order against the bill and against its consideration are waived. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments. Upon passage by the House, H.R. 1430 shall be considered to constitute reconciliation legislation pursuant to section 7(a) of the conference report to accompany the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 64) setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for the fiscal years 1994, 1995, 1996, 1997, and 1998.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
Mr. Gingrich moved to recommit with instructions to Ways and Means.

DEBATE - The House proceeded with ten minutes of debate on the Gingrich motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Ways and Means with instructions that the committee report the bill back with an amendment to reduce the increase in the debt limit by $14 billion.
On motion to recommit with instructions Failed by recorded vote: 168 - 245 (Roll no. 132).

vote.text: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 237 - 177 (Roll no. 133).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

calendar.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 56.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 3/23/1993--Introduced. Provides for a temporary increase in the public debt limit.
